title: Jasprit Bumrah
summary: Jasprit Bumrah is an Indian cricketer who plays for the Indian national cricket team.

value.label: Bumrah is a right arm fast bowler who consistently bowls at 140–145 kmph making him one of the fastest bowlers in India.
Bumrah plays first-class cricket for Gujarat and he made his debut against Vidarbha in October 2013
The Ranji Trophy is a domestic first-class cricket championship played in India between teams representing regional and state cricket associations.

value.label: Bumrah made his international debut playing an ODI for India versus Australia
The Australia national cricket team is the joint oldest team in Test cricket history, having played in the first ever Test match in 1877.

image.altText: Image of Australia national cricket team

value.label: In the Champions Trophy 2017 final, Bumrah bowled a no-ball which could have been the wicket of the batsman who eventually scored a century that helped the opposition win the match.
In his Indian Premier League debut match versus RCB, Bumrah took 3 wickets

The Mumbai Indians are a franchise cricket team based in the city of Mumbai, Maharashtra. Founded in 2008, Mumbai Indians play in the Indian Premier League (IPL). The team is owned by India's biggest conglomerate, Reliance Industries.
Bumrah is the first Asian bowler to take 5 wickets in a test innings in South Africa, England and Australia during the same calendar year

value.label: Bumrah took 7 wickets in his debut first class match playing for Gujarat versus Vidharbha

value.label: The India national cricket team is also known as Team India and Men in Blue. India is ranked first in Tests, second in ODIs and second in T20Is by the ICC. Virat Kohli is the current captain of the team, while the head coach is Ravi Shastri.

image.altText: Picture of India national cricket team

value.label: The Mumbai Indians are a franchise cricket team based in the city of Mumbai, Maharashtra. Founded in 2008, Mumbai Indians play in the Indian Premier League (IPL). The team is owned by India's biggest conglomerate, Reliance Industries.
Gujarat cricket team is one of three Ranji Trophy cricket teams representing the state of Gujarat
